problem.markdown:
>> Spectral transistion has important property of position and frequency. The other imporant properties
(x) width and intensity () width and broadness () intensity and broadness () all the above
>> Calculate the stretching frequencies of C=C bond:
(x) 1650 cm-1 () 3000 cm-1 () 2206 cm-1 () 1750 cm-1
>> Air contains two major infrared active molecules:
() nitrogen and oxygen () nitrogen and water vapour () oxygen and carbon dioxide (x) carbon dioxide and water vapour
>> At 100 MHz frequency NMR spectrometer, the shift of the methyl bromide protons is 270 Hz from TMS. Calculate the chemical shift (?) of the compound:
(x) 2.70 ppm () 0.370 ppm () 3.70 ppm () 0.27 ppm
>> The distance between the peaks in a simple multiplet is called :
() spin multiplicity () pascal triangle (x) coupling constant () chemical shift
>> The solvent used for proton NMR measurements should contain deuterium:
() to get a refine spectrum () because it is easy to solve the spectrum () protons can be located with deuterium as references (x) for locking and shimming purposed on FT NMR instruments
>> A metastable ion peak in a mass spectrum is the:
() highest intensity peak () less stable peak which are hardly seen in a mass spectra (x) broad peak which frequently appear at nonintegral values of m/z () broad peaks which appear at the M+ ion value
>> The molecular ion peak in an aldehyde is:
() usually weak for both aromatic and aliphatic aldehyde () usually weak for an aromatic aldehyde () strong for an aliphatic aldehyde (x) weak for an aliphatic aldehyde and strong for an aromatic aldehyde
>> The molecuar ion peak for nitro compounds are seldom seen in a mass spectra. The nitro compounds can be indentified by:
(x) moderate peak at m/z = 30 corresponding to NO+ and weak peak at m/z =46 corresponding to NO2+ ions () strong peaks at m/z = 30 corresponding to NO+ and weak peak at m/z =46 corresponding to NO2+ ions () only a weak peak at m/z =46 corresponding to NO2+ ions () only a moderate peak at m/z = 30 corresponding to NO+
>> Carbon dioxide laser which is a mixture of carbon dioxide and nitrogen has a potential use in routine:
(x) Infrared spectroscopy () mass spectroscopy () NMR spectroscopy () Laser technology

problem.p: >> A metastable ion peak in a mass spectrum is the:

choicegroup.choice: less stable peak which are hardly seen in a mass spectra
broad peak which frequently appear at nonintegral values of m/z
broad peaks which appear at the M+ ion value

problem.p: >> The molecular ion peak in an aldehyde is:

choicegroup.choice: usually weak for both aromatic and aliphatic aldehyde
usually weak for an aromatic aldehyde
weak for an aliphatic aldehyde and strong for an aromatic aldehyde

problem.p: >> The molecuar ion peak for nitro compounds are seldom seen in a mass spectra. The nitro compounds can be indentified by:

choicegroup.choice: moderate peak at m/z = 30 corresponding to NO+ and weak peak at m/z =46 corresponding to NO2+ ions
strong peaks at m/z = 30 corresponding to NO+ and weak peak at m/z =46 corresponding to NO2+ ions
only a weak peak at m/z =46 corresponding to NO2+ ions
only a moderate peak at m/z = 30 corresponding to NO+
